intro: Ixora brunonis subsp. brunonis, commonly known as the Australian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and elliptical in shape, with a smooth texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
